file_content.text: I welcome you in the name of the Order of Revan.
Go. Your next guide awaits you.
You. Your words are meaningless to me--but the trail of corpses you leave proves you have power.
I judge you worthy of initiation--yet your trial is just beginning.
Oh?
I'm glad that I could earn your respect.
You honor me.
As am I.
Don't try me.
Fight, initiate. Fight the beasts of the jungle, and show your strength.
So. You have come. You who would join the Order of Revan.
I am Morrun Dokaas, lord of beasts. I am Revanite, and I am Sith. What do you say to me?
Morrun Dokaas--I've come to prove myself worthy.
I greet you in honor.
Very well. Then listen.
I haven't seen many non-human Sith.
You're an alien?
What do you expect me to say? "I'm very impressed"?
Congratulations?
I do not need your praise, initiate.
For decades, I have served the Master. He found me when I was a larva and saw that I was strong in the Force.
Against the Empire's traditions, he trained me. This is the way of Revan--to teach all species the path to power.
Truly, you are an abomination--an alien wretch.
Freakish weakling.
Others have said the same. Their bones are buried beneath the moss and loam at your feet.
Your Master is brave to defy tradition that way... brave or a fool.
A rebel, eh?
He is not a fool.
I've defied the Empire's traditions, myself. The Korriban Academy is not kind to aliens.
Sith like us are very few.
No. You are brave, to have survived there.
Breaking Imperial tradition can be a dangerous thing.
Your Master took a risk.
Indeed it can.
Sith philosophy isn't any of my business.
This Force talk isn't for me.
I see.
Good.
What's your point, exactly?
So?
It is something you must consider if you are to be a Revanite. It will shape you. Change you.
Now you will answer a question--and you will answer well, or face the claws of my pets.
Why do you think Revan trained aliens in the ways of the Sith? Why did Revan offer power to all seekers?
He believed everyone should have the chance to aspire to power.
It was just.
Your answer is not my answer. But it is... sufficient. It is worthy of a Revanite.
It was an act of kindness.
He was merciful.
Never forget that Revan was Sith. And there is no kindness among the Sith. You have failed to prove your worth.
You were warned that your strength would be tested. To redeem yourself, you may walk through the jungle.
Travel as Revan did through the Shadowlands of Kashyyyk. Face the terrors of nature. If you return alive, I will reconsider my judgment.
Revan knew that servants are more useful when they're powerful.
It gave him an edge.
You answer well. You answer wisely. You speak like a true Revanite.
You may proceed on your pilgrimage and seek worth in the eyes of another.
Who should I be looking for?
Another?
A Revanite. A great warrior, and a favored student of the Master.
Any suggestions on how to deal with this guide?
Do you have any advice?
No. You will do this on your own.
Fine. I'll do it.
Seek the mercenary called Ceta Farr as she teaches her soldiers. Then shall your trial continue.
Leave now--this is not your place.
